capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Strategic implementation of environmental water programs requires advanced planning and prioritization skills to manage complex projects and achieve ecological outcomes.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Developing solutions for the management and conservation of wetlands and rivers involves complex problem-solving skills, considering ecological, hydrological, and legislative factors.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Responsible for monitoring, evaluation, and reporting against ecological objectives, ensuring actions align with legislative and policy requirements.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Must present complex technical information clearly to non-technical audiences and develop effective partnerships with key stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Requires a collaborative approach to work across government and non-government organisations, ensuring the effective use of environmental water.

capabilities.name: Influence and Negotiate
capabilities.description: Engaging with various stakeholders to gain consensus and commitment on water use and conservation strategies.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Acknowledges and respects diverse backgrounds, especially the custodial responsibilities of Aboriginal peoples towards the environment.

capabilities.name: Environmental Science
capabilities.description: Requires in-depth knowledge of river and wetland ecology, hydrology, and environmental conservation practices.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Building and maintaining relationships with government, community, and industry partners for environmental conservation efforts.

skills.name: Legislative Compliance
skills.description: Understanding and applying relevant environmental legislation and policies, including water and biodiversity conservation laws.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.description: Coordinating environmental water programs, including planning, delivery, monitoring, and reporting.

generalRole.title: Environmental Conservation Officer
generalRole.description: This role focuses on the strategic planning, implementation, and management of environmental conservation projects, specifically related to wetlands and rivers. It involves collaboration with stakeholders, application of environmental science knowledge, and adherence to legislative requirements to achieve ecological outcomes.
